Start with a set of chosen values (of an index)

Source: R/start_with_some_values.R
start_with_some_values.Rd

Create an xtibble() object from values of an index. Higher order helper to construct an xtibble() object and its index with a shorter call.

start_with_some_values(x, period = 31L, unit = 18L, idx_name = "idx")

Arguments

x

A vector of strings. The set of roles.

period

An integer, the period of the index() (default 31L).

unit

An integer, the unit of the index() (default 18L).

idx_name

A string, the column name for the index (default "idx").

Value

An xtibble() with one column.

See also

Other start_with_: start_with_mode(), start_with_some_notes(), start_with_some_roles()

Examples

# Ionian mode
start_with_some_values((0:6) - 1)
#> # A tibble: 7 × 1
#>          idx
#>   <i<18/31>>
#> 1         -1
#> 2        ~ 0
#> 3          1
#> 4          2
#> 5          3
#> 6          4
#> 7          5
